titleStmt.title: A Description in Answer to the Journal,

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: NEAR St. Sepulchres stands a Building,
Which as Report goes ne'er had Child in
The House is large, and to adorn her,
From Garret down to Chimney Corner:
The Upper Chambers were well lin'd,
With Antique Books; and Books new Coin'd,
Which plainly shew'd it's Founders Head,
With Learning of all sorts supply'd.
The House on every part was stor'd,
To Entertain the greatest Lord;
Nor did the Poorest meet Disdain,
But fill his Belly with his Brain.
The Kitching, Grates: like Vesta's Altar,
Had Fire in't, when e're you call Sir!
There were appointed Vestal Dames,
To stir up the devouring Flames:
On these were laid Fat Pigs and Geese.
All Beasts, and Foul for Sacrifice.
The Sea it self could not escape,
For Fish of all sorts here would Gape,
And bleed, Soles, Salmons, Lobsters, Cods,
To gratify the hungry Gods.
And to drive off the Minds dejection,
Wit flew about, but no Reflection,
To keep the Spirits in Viberation,
Wine join'd with Wit for the Labation.
The Dean was small, his Soul was Large,
He new his Duty to discharge;
He lov'd his Chapter, treated all, 3}
His Dignitaries, Vicars-Chorrall,
From Tall-boy, down to little W──l,
In short he Liv'd and that's what few can,
Justly report of Sw--t our new Dean.
He sometimes to a Chapter goes,
With sawcy strut and turn'd up Nose;
Leans on his Cushion, then he'll bid ye,
Hearken, to what all knowns already.
Perhaps he'll sneer, or break a Jest,
But Deel a bit to break your Fast.
Go when you please, let the Clock strike,
What Hour it will 'tis all alike:
Some Country Preb──── comes just at One,
In hopes to dine and so begon.
The Dean appears, I'm glad to see you,
Pray tell what Service I can do you,
Be quick for I am going out,
The hungary Levites Vex'd no doubt,
To be thus baulk'd tucks up his Gown,
Makes a low scrape, and so to Town;
Is welcome there, and makes a shift:
To Drink a Glass, and rail at Sw──t.
But of this Farce you'll known the reason.
You shall, I'm sure it can't be Treason.
He Dines abroad you think, mistaken,
He Dines at home on Sprouts and Bacon.
Besides his two Chief Slaves are missing,
To Broach his Drink and Broyle his Grisking,
Pert Jack, and Robin, I mean Gr────on,
As Suppliant Slaves as e're had Hat on,
Such Slaves as those you know delights him.
Who're sure to Trudge when he invites 'em,
And that's often as in his Kitchen,
A Fire is made to broyl a Pidgeon.
The Seventeenth of March each year,
The Chapter meets to make good Cheer,
The Dean's allow'd five pounds or more,
To entertain 'bout half a score,
Your sure to meet a handsom dish,
Of Salmon or some other Fish,
A dish of Soop, a Leg of Mutton,
By servants are the Table put on,
A Plate with Puddings there next comes.
One Plain, One Almond, tother Plumbs.
The second course adon's the Table.
With Loyn of Beef most forbidable,
A Salad with a dish of Fowl,
Of this huge Treat makes up the Whole,
Now if some Critick should accost him,
And ask, How much this Dinner Cost him?
He cou'd not say that he had lost,
Any great matter by the Roast,
The Treat just as the Dean bespoke it
Put two Pound Ten into his Pocket?
Besides the Fragments of the Feast,
Will feed his House a Week at least,
As for himself, with draggled Gown,
Poor Curate like, he'll trudge the Town,
To Eat a Meal with Punster base,
Or Buffoon, call him if you please?
Sometimes to Gawls-Town he will go,
To spend a Month or two or so,
Admires the Baron, George and's Spouse,
Lives well, and then Lampoon's the House.
Thus far our Bard in doggrel Rhyme;
In the Dean's Kitchin spent his Time?
He's dull because there is no Fire,
Or Wine his rustick Muse t'inspire,
But let's proceed from those poor tricks,
O'th Kitchen to his Politick's,
On Plots and Schemes, he'll read long Lectures
To Country Curates and their Rectors?
They stare and think he knows as well,
All depths of State as Machieavel,
It must be so since from him flows
Whate'er the Earl of Oxford knows;
And swears the project of the Peace,
Was laid by him in Anna's Days;
The South Sea ne're could have miscarried,
As he contriv'd, but Others Marr'd it,
Thus he goes on two Hours or more,
And tells the same thing o're and o're
The darkest plots he can unravel,
And split them ope' from Head to Navel,
What dire effects o'er Band Box hover'd,
Venice preserv'd, the Plots discover'd,
Venice here stands for's great Mæcenas.
The Earl of Oxford not Ænneas.
And yet when all is done or said,
A Tale of a Tub fills up his Head,
Thus having given a description.
Of this great Wit and Politition,
I now surrender my Commission.
